annotations.content: This is the foundational test run that validates the core browser automation infrastructure. It uses a simple, stable target (example.com) to verify that Playwright can launch in headless mode, navigate to a URL, wait for page load, query for elements, and capture screenshots both of full pages and specific elements.

This test establishes the baseline for all subsequent testing. The choice of example.com is deliberate - it's a minimal, stable page maintained by IANA that will not change, making it ideal for regression testing of the automation system itself rather than the CV Builder application.

The test demonstrates two screenshot modes: full-page capture (scrolling through entire document) and element-specific capture (targeting a single DOM element by selector). Both modes work correctly in headless mode without requiring a visible browser window.
